history.proof: intros i j. unfold mymax. case (le_gt_dec i j); intro H. - qsimpl time: 1. - sfirstorder depth: 3use: mymax_l.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall i j : nat, mymax i j >= j

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
mymax = fun m n : nat => if le_gt_dec m n then n else m : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments mymax (_ _)%nat_scope
mymax_l : forall i j : nat, mymax i j >= i
closed_monotonic : LiftLift -> forall k t : nat, closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> closed j t
closed_lift_invariant : forall k t : nat, closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> forall w : nat, lift w j t = t
closed_subst_invariant : forall (k : nat) (t : ?T), closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> forall v : ?V, subst v j t = t where ?T : [ |- Type] ?H : [ |- Lift ?T] ?V : [ |- Type] ?H0 : [ |- Subst ?V ?T] ?arg_5 : [ |- LiftLift] ?arg_6 : [ |- SubstLift]
ge_dec : forall n m : nat, {n >= m} + {~ n >= m}
dec_ge : forall n m : nat, Decidable.decidable (n >= m)
le_ge_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {n >= m}
not_lt : forall n m : nat, ~ n < m -> n >= m
not_ge : forall n m : nat, ~ n >= m -> n < m
Reflect.Nat_ge_leb : forall a b : nat, a >= b < -> is_true (b <=? a)
closed_var : forall k x : nat, x >= k -> closed k x -> False
Znat.inj_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m -> BinInt.Z.ge (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> BinInt.Z.ge (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
nat_compare_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> (n ?= m) <> Lt
RingMicromega.ge_bool_cases : forall n m : nat, if RingMicromega.ge_bool n m then n >= m else n < m
Pnat.Pos2Nat.inj_ge : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.ge p q < -> BinPos.Pos.to_nat p >= BinPos.Pos.to_nat q
app_nth2 : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (d : A) (n : nat), n >= length l -> nth n (l ++ l') d = nth (n - length l) l' d
lift_lift_reversed : LiftLift -> forall wk k ws s t : nat, k >= s + ws -> lift wk k (lift ws s t) = lift ws s (lift wk (k - ws) t)
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_rect : forall P : nat -> Type, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
Fin.t_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t -> P (S n) (Fin.FS t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t
Nat.le_0_l : forall n : nat, 0 <= n
le_n : forall n : nat, n <= n
gt_irrefl : forall n : nat, ~ n > n

```coq
intros i j.
unfold mymax.
case (le_gt_dec i j); intro H.
- rewrite H. apply ge_refl.
- rewrite H. apply mymax_l.
Qed.
```

original: intros i j. unfold mymax. case (le_gt_dec i j); intro H. - rewrite H. apply ge_refl. - rewrite H. apply mymax_l.
